title: Function Concepts - Tabular and Analytical: Logarithmic

content.description:
<math alttext="x"> <mi>x</mi> </math>
 <math alttext="1"> <mn>1</mn> </math>
 <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>
 <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>
 <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math>
 <math alttext="5"> <mn>5</mn> </math>

<math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses"> <mi>f</mi> <mfenced> <mi>x</mi> </mfenced> </math>
 <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>
 <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>
 <math alttext="5"> <mn>5</mn> </math>
 <math alttext="3"> <mn>3</mn> </math>
 <math alttext="1"> <mn>1</mn> </math>

The domain of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> consists of the five real numbers <math alttext="1"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2"><mn>2</mn></math>, <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>, <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math>, and <math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math>. The table defines the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> for these values. The function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 ln x"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>ln</mi><mi>x</mi></math>.
content.question:
Part A

(i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g circle f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 4 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(ii) Find all values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, or indicate that there are no such values.

frqParts.text:
Part A

(i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g circle f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 4 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>4</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer.

(ii) Find all values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> for which <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, or indicate that there are no such values.

Part B

(i) Find all values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>, as decimal approximations, for which <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 3"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, or indicate that there are no such values.

(ii) Determine the end behavior of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

Part C

(i) Does the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> have an inverse function?

(ii) Give a reason for your answer in part C(i) based on properties of the function \(f\). Refer to the values in the table in your reasoning.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
